fields.description: Need ability to define a separate set of statuses for SubTasks.  We do not display these on the board and the statuses that we have for Stories, Bugs and Tasks are different from what we need for SubTasks.
fields.summary: Ability to configure separate statuses for SubTasks

fields.description: I would like the ability to create a Program level project, create epics within that project, then create multiple child Projects (each for a separate team) belonging to the same Program and then link issues (User Stories) within the child projects to Epics within the Program.
fields.summary: Program - Project Hierarchy

fields.description:
h3. Summary:
The board picker appears in the middle of the reports context (In between "All reports" and the reports link)
 * !Screenshot 2021-02-05 at 3.22.51 PM.png|width=299,height=139!

h3. Suggestion:

It should appear on top of the report's context, probably on top of "Back to project".
fields.summary: The board picker appears in the wrong place in the reports page

fields.description:
If a user configures an Application Link from Jira Cloud to Bitbucket Server using a different display URL instead of the same as the application URL, the feature to create a _Branch_ from a Jira issue will redirect to the application URL instead of the display URL.

*Steps to Reproduce*:
 # Have a clean Jira Software Cloud and Bitbucket Server with the latest version.
 # Go to Application Links in Jira and configure it so that:
 ** Application URL: http://localhost:7990/
 ** Display URL: http://test.com:7990/
 # After the Application Links configured, navigate to any issue in Jira Cloud, and then click on *Create Branch*
 # Notice the link you are directed to, is {{localhost:7990}} instead of {{test.com:7990}}

This behavior also affects the *Application Navigator* for Jira, whereby it directs to {{localhost:7990}} instead of {{test.com:7990}}.
fields.summary: Jira Cloud link to Bitbucket Server is not using the display URL

fields.description:
More JQL functions should be available to fetch issues from project(s) linked to the EPICs in a different project.

Something like:
Child in EPIC( 'issuetype = Epic AND Project = ABC')
fields.summary: More functions in JQL to fetch epic and child linking

fields.description:
Keep Text Formatting visible on top of the Description field if you scroll down so that you won't have to scroll back up to change the format of your selected text.

 

 

When there's no text:

!image-2021-02-04-10-29-35-878.png!

 

If you scroll down to see text at the bottom of the Description field, the ruler is hidden up top.

!image-2021-02-04-10-33-26-039.png!
fields.summary: Keep Text Formatting visible on Ticket Description field

fields.description:
Customer wants Plan Setting and Review changes section in AR to be a panel that can be expanded/collapsed when needed for a better view of scope and issues.

 

!image-2021-02-04-13-37-31-973.png|width=574,height=124!
fields.summary: expand/collapse panel option in plan setting and review changes section for a better view in Advanced Roadmap

fields.description:
For the time being, it's not possible to select the *Teams* on *To* for the action *Send email*.

It would be awesome to have that ability.
fields.summary: Allow automation rule action 'Send email' to send emails to Teams

fields.description:
Currently, the Agile Wallboard Gadget only allows you to view the board in the dashboard, but this is only a read-only view as it does not allow you to drag and drop the issues across columns directly from the gadget. 

It would be helpful if this feature can be added to enable teams to work directly from the dashboard view.
fields.summary: Allow moving issues directly from the Agile Wallboard Gadget

fields.description:
We use Jira in combination with Zeplin for all the layouts. Therefore it would be totally awesome to have app integrations like Zeplin also show up in the Mac App.

----

I can fully understand, that the Mac app does not, and maybe never will have the full feature set, that the web has. But I think it would be awesome to have at least all information displayed on a ticket. 

If you have to change account, project settings or whatever, going to the web is totally fine. But "missing" information on a ticket feels a bit strange to me.
fields.summary: Mac App: App integrations

fields.description:
h3. Description
When accessing a Kanban board, I can see the list of the subtasks under a task, story or other standard issue type. 

It would be helpful to be able to drag a drop a subtask to another task to change the parent issue type and add this subtask to this other task. 

h3. Workaround
As a workaround, the user must click on "More" in the buttons at the top, then "Move". There, the user will be able to change the Parent for this subtask.
fields.summary: As a user, on a Kanban board I'd like to drag and drop a subtask to another task or story to change the parent issue

fields.description:
h3. Current scenario
Currently, we can only show:
* All issues
* 500 issues
* 100 issues

 !image-2021-02-02-14-54-39-208.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Desired scenario
It would be good to have more options as depending on the board set up, this could potentially mitigate performance issues and get things more organized.

Example: 50 issues
fields.summary: Create more values options for issue display in Classic scrum boards

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the dependency report, dependencies that are due on the same day or the day before have a 'blocks (0 days)' arrow to indicate the dependency relationship but have different coloured arrows.
Dependencies that are due on the same day as the start date of the dependent issue will have a red coloured arrow.
Dependencies that are due the day before the start date of the dependent issue will have a grey/blue arrow.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 3 tasks in the plan
 ## Set task 1 to have an end date of 11 Feb
 ## Set task 2 to have an end date of 12 Feb
 ## Set task 3 to have a start date of 12 Feb
 # Make task 3 depend on task 1 and task 2 
 [https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiraportfolioserver/scheduling-dependencies-968677365.html]
 # Go to the dependencies report

h3. Expected Results

There should be difference in number of days blocking between task 1 and task 2
h3. Actual Results

The number of days blocking is 0 days for both task 1 and task 2

!Screen Shot 2021-02-02 at 2.54.36 pm.png!
h3. Workaround

n/a
fields.summary: Dependency report shows "blocks (0 days)" for dependencies due on same day and day before

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we upload a single non-image file to the description of a ticket, it becomes very difficult to enter edit mode as the click area is not obvious - only the area just below the file will get you into edit mode, the large space to the right of the file will not allow you to get into edit mode.

(i) The problem only happens in the new issue view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open a ticket
 # Upload a non-image file to the description field (eg .sql, .pdf, .txt)
 # Try to edit the description field

h3. Expected Results
The description field should be editable
h3. Actual Results
The description field is not editable

h3. Workaround
Hover over the file to show the text box grey outline, and click on the extra space just below the file

See below a video showing it:

* [^workaroundBugSqlFileDescription.mp4]
fields.summary: Uploading a single non-image file into the description field makes it difficult to enter edit mode

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A Plan would no longer open and crash every time with a 500 error if one of your Issue source Boards is using "ORDER BY Rank ASC" as its filter.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Board using a saved filter such as "ORDER BY Rank ASC"
 # Add this Board to the Issue sources of your Plan
 !_ORDER_BY_Rank_ASC__Issue_navigator_-_Jira.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

You should be able to open your Plan and if the amount of Issues surpasses the [5000 issue limit|https://confluence.atlassian.com/advancedroadmapscloud/working-with-plans-998651020.html], then some performance problems are expected.

h3. Actual Results

The Plan will not open and crash with a 500 error.

 !Oops_-_an_error_has_occurred.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

If you are able to identify which Issue source Board is causing this, you can go directly to its saved filter and adjust the JQL from there. Otherwise, you can reach out to [+Atlassian Support+|https://support.atlassian.com/contact] for assistance, referencing this bug.
fields.summary: Plan cannot open with 500 error from Issue source Board filter

fields.description:
When I try to filter the tickets which are not linked with the test cases using the JQL method it showing this error message. 
 

!https://community.atlassian.com/t5/image/serverpage/image-id/128215iD6364FA912F2D964/image-size/large?v=1.0&px=999!

Please add the search criteria for "Test Case/Acceptance Criteria"
so that it is useful to search the tickets which are linked with test cases.
fields.summary: Add a search criteria for "Test Case/Acceptance Criteria"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Raised in support ticket [https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JST-631264]
A user that does not have permission to manage sprints (such as having a 'viewer' role) can start or complete a sprint when they should not be able to.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set a user to a role which does not have the 'manage sprints' permission for a project that has sprints enabled
 # Sign in as that user
 # From the board or backlog click the "start sprint" or "complete sprint" button and confirm.

h3. Expected Results

The button should not be visible or should prevent the user from starting/completing the sprint as they do not have the appropriate permission.
h3. Actual Results

The user can complete or start the sprint as if they had the correct permission
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: A user without manage sprint permission is able to start/complete sprints on next gen boards and backlog

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the commit file count exceeds 5 the correct number of files changed is not displayed in the development details dialogue. Instead, the file count will be listed as 5 files.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a commit with more than 5 files and link it using the Jira Issue Key
 # Go to the issue view in Jira and click on the commits row in the development summary.
 # Wait for the commits tab to load in the development details dialogue
 # Observe the number of files to be listed as 5 files, click on the file count to see a list of files.
 # Click on "See More ..." to observe the correct file count.

h3. Expected Results

The total number of files changed in the commit should be accurately reflected in the development details dialogue.
h3. Actual Results

The file count never exceeds 5 files in the commits table.
h3. Workaround

If the user needs to see the correct number of files altered they can show the files for a commit and click "See more on.." to see the correct details.
fields.summary: Users are unable to see the correct file count on the commits tab in development details dialogue

fields.description:
h3. Problem
In a Nextgen Kanban Board, when we Group-By "Sub-task", the parent summary gets cut-off on the board.

For Example, the story summary is like: _*Screenshot1*_ 
- On the Kanban Board, we can't see the complete Story Summary: _*Screenshot2*_

h3. Suggested Solution
_It would be really nice if we can see the complete parent issue Summary, without opening the parent issue _
fields.summary: Story Summary gets cut-off in next gen kanban project

fields.description:
Bulk moving issues from the team-managed (formerly next-gen) project to the company-managed (formerly classic) project doesn't give an option to map the issue key and hence the issue counters are lost and the new issue numbers are created in the destination project. 

*Workaround:*
Export the issues using CSV from team-managed (formerly next-gen) and import them back to a company-managed (formerly classic) project and map the issue key's to retain the same issue numbers as that of the source project.
fields.summary: Bulk moving issues from team-managed to company-managed project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When renaming a sprint, the sprint is indeed renamed as expected, yet, it requires the user to refresh the page to see it taken place.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new Scrum board
# Try to rename a sprint on it
# Sprint will be renamed, but user needs to refresh the page in order to see the change.
# After reproducing this in a new Scrum board, it's very likely the user will also reproduce the issue in other existing Scrum boards

h3. Expected Results
Page should be responsive enough to display the new name straight away

h3. Actual Results
The sprint is indeed renamed as expected, yet, it requires the user to refresh the page to see it taken place.

h3. Workaround
Refresh the page in order to see the rename.
fields.summary: Renaming a sprint shouldn't require a page refresh to be displayed

fields.description:
After one adds subtasks to a user story and then visualizes the active sprint board, stories with subtasks are placed above stories with no subtasks.

It makes it harder to visualize the whole sprint state since we have to scroll more to view the different parts of our sprints, and task/story priority becomes messed up.

I am suggesting a different view style that would keep all stories together, but would still allow us to view sub-tasks if required.

As an example, Azure Devops does it this way:

!image-2021-01-28-08-34-27-153.png!
fields.summary: Board with subtask - better view

fields.description:
As a Product Manager

I want to mark an issue as Cancelled

So that I can accurately report and review historic issues

 

Given I am creating a Jira Next Gen Project

When I select the options for a column

Then I should be able to select "Set as Cancelled Column"

Or I should be able to select "Set as Done Column"

 

Given I have selected "Set as Cancelled Column"

And a small "X" icon appears in the column

And set the column name "Cancelled"

When I move an issue to state "Cancelled"

Then the behavior of Jira should be the same if set to "Done"
fields.summary: Add Cancelled as a state to Next Gen Board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using a local URL such as {{http://mylocalservice:9999}} on the OAuth Credentials page is rejected as an invalid URL, even though it is valid.

This has the effect that you cannot link a locally running tool such as Jenkins, TeamCity etc. to Jira unless it is accessible via a URL of the form "http://host.domain".
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Goto Apps -> OAuth Credentials
 # Create a new credential
 # For the home and logo URLs, populate a local URL of the form `http://mylocalservice:1234`
 # Fill in the other required information
 # Hit "create"

h3. Expected Results

A new credential is created
h3. Actual Results

URL is marked as invalid
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Local URLs are rejected as invalid in the oauth credentials page

fields.description: When using the board and group by epic and viewing multiple epics it would be great to see the epic color you have set.  Right now they all just show w/the epic symbol - which are all the same color box.
fields.summary: On board when group by epic see epic color

fields.description:
I am trying to create a request and based on my selection of a custom field while creating the request, i am trying to assign a sequential no to each request. For ex, 
for type1 selection it would be 100 and then incremented by 1 for such future requests and 
for type2 request it would be 10 and then incremented by 1 for such future requests.
fields.summary: Unable to create incremental field based on Custom field selection

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Basic Roadmap throws errors and doesn't open when Browse Project permission is set based on Product Access

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Make sure to have Jira Core, Jira Software and Jira Service Management enabled
# On your Jira Software Classic Project, update the Project Browser Permission to restrict access based on Application Access(Jira Software)
# Enable Roadmaps on your Classic Project
# Switch over the Backlog and Roadmaps, sometimes, it throws an error and doesn't load the Roadmap

h3. Expected Results
It should load the Roadmap 100% of time if you meet the Product Access criteria from the Browse Project Permission

h3. Actual Results
Sometimes, it cannot resolve the Product Access from the Browse Project Permission and throws an error that the project is not accessible or just a Something went wrong error.

h3. Workaround
Avoid using Product Access on Browse Project Permission in order to restrict access to the project. Instead of that, use Jira groups or allow any logged in user to avoid facing this bug.
fields.summary: Basic Roadmap throws error and don't open when Browse Project permission is set based on Product Access

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a board has a broad JQL query and/or long history, causing its reports to go through a large number of issues & history, the reports may experience long load times and fail to load with timeout errors.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a board with a broad JQL query, for example, one that includes all projects on an instance
 # Try loading a sprint report

h3. Expected Results

The report should load data from all the included issues within a reasonable time period. A reasonable time period would ideally be under 4 seconds, but may simply be considered under 10s. Currently large reports may take tens of seconds to load.
h3. Actual Results

The report takes tens of seconds to load or does not load due to timeout exceptions.
h3. Workaround

The only available work-around at the moment is to use less broad JQL queries to use reports that contain less issues and history.
fields.summary: Performance issues in agile reports with a large history or number of issues with potential timeout failures

fields.description: This is for our PMO Team BA Meeting
fields.summary: BA Meeting

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, in Dependency linking for Advance roadmaps, the option requires adding a value to the inward and outward links manually for the issue you want to link, and in [basic Roadmaps|https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/manage-dependencies-between-epics-on-the-roadmap/], there is a visual drag and drop option for the linking option in the roadmap view allowing for a visual linking process.

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be beneficial to add in a matching visual icon drag and drop link option to align the mapping features between basic and advanced roadmap dependent linking feature
fields.summary: Add Drag and Drop Dependency linking to Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Using the keyboard's arrow keys is not working for scrolling down the list of issues, neither in the active sprint view nor in the backlog.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Access a Scrum board's Active sprint view or backlog;
* Try to scroll down the list of issues using the arrow keys.

h3. Expected Results

The page should scroll down or up.

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens when using the arrow keys.

h3. Workaround

Use your mice's scroll button (middle), touchpad, or manually drag the scroll bar in your browser.
fields.summary: It is not possible to scroll down in agile boards using arrow keys

fields.description:
h3. Problem
Issues can't be moved from backlog to the board by using drag and drop.

The issue is seen in the Kanban backlog, but unable to move to board  as he has two transition from backlog to the first column of the board. In this case, customer cannot drag and drop and works only when we manually assign to one of the transitions available.

h3. Environment
Classic project, kanban board with backlog enabled

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create two transitions from backlog status to the status mapped on the first column of the board.
# Create an issue
# From Kanban Backlog, try to move the issue from backlog to the first column of the board. Refresh the board and the issue will be on backlog.

 
h3. Expected Results
Under Kanban backlog, there should be an area for the two transitions under the next status where issues can be respectively moved.

h3. Actual Results
Under kanban backlog, there is no area which shows the two transitions , where the issue can be moved and thus the issue falls back to backlog and is not transitioned to next status in the board

h3. Workaround
Open the issue and transition (no drag and drop)

h3. Notes
fields.summary: Unable to move issues from Backlog to the next status from Kanban Backlog

fields.description:
In the old view the linking was great it was <issueID><status>

!image-2021-01-26-08-35-48-192.png!

In the new view it's <issueID><title><status>  

!image-2021-01-26-08-35-40-244.png!
fields.summary: Linking of other JIRA tickets now takes up too much room.

fields.description:
Raising on a user's behalf:

Allow modifying the Jira default objects to other terms in Jira to correlate with the different industry terminologies. I need to rename/change the following object names:

1. Project change to Facility - because each growing facility is handled as a separate entity.
2. Component - Location - because it is a facility location, a combination of an area, rack, and shelves.
3. Issues - Work Items - because issues are, in fact, their work items.

Also, allow an option to show/hide the sections like Reports, Releases, etc., in classic project type.
fields.summary: Options to update Jira object like Project, Issue, Components etc

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The backlog view has a divider line that can be used to include/exclude issues from the sprint, putting them into the backlog. See the highlighted line below:
 !Screen Shot 2021-01-25 at 10.20.51.png|thumbnail! 

Currently, using that line is impacting the total Story points estimate displayed in the backlog view. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce

There are different behaviours: 
* Filtering by version or by Epic:
** While dragging the divider, the total value displayed does not consider the filtering (it shows only the total);
** When dropping the divider at a point, the total values will show the filtered value again;
** See the recording:  [^Sprint divider behaviour - Epic and version filter.mp4] 
* Filtering by Epic and Version - behaviour 2 (affects quick filter usage as well):
** When moving the divider up and down trough the list of issues, the total estimation value might be completely lost;
** When dropping the divider, the value displayed will be the last one displayed while navigating instead of the correct total value of your filter criteria;
** See the recording:  [^Sprint divider beahviour - Epic and versions.mp4] 
* Using quick filters: 
** When using quick filters, if you end up putting the divider to a point where the estimate is set to 0 (zero), when dropping the divider the estimate will not reset to the correct value;
** See the recording:  [^Sprint divider behaviour - quick filters.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results

The total estimate should be correctly displayed after using the divider.

h3. Actual Results

The total estimate might be completely messed up.

h3. Workaround

A possible workaround is to reload the page. During my tests, that would display the correct total estimate, as well as keep the current division and filtering.
fields.summary: Sprint divider messes with the total estimate displayed

fields.description:
h3. Problem

The topmost swimlane of a board (Kanban or Scrum) does not display a tooltip when you hover your mouse on the title - only every other swimlane after the first will show the tooltip.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Create a board
 * Configure swimlanes on the board (it could be based on Epic, Queries, Assignees, Stories, Projects)
 * Populate data on the project/board to produce swimlanes
 * Hover your mouse across the title/name of the swimlanes

h3. Expected Results

e.g when the swimlane is based on Queries
 * Hovering your mouse across the title of any of the swimlanes should show a tooltip of the number of issues in the swimlane and the description of the JQL configured.
 * !Screen Shot 2021-01-25 at 6.07.19 pm.png|thumbnail!

h3. Actual Results
 * Hovering your mouse across the title of the first swimlane produces no tooltip, but every other swimlane after the first shows the tooltip

h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Tooltip of the top swimlane of a board is not displayed on mouseover

fields.description:
User to have the ability to select a project or possibility of displaying the create screen when using Manual trigger automation 

Maybe a possibility of displaying the create screen using a manual trigger automation rule? (as opposed to setting the fields within the rule)

I would like the user to be able to define the fields on the create screen versus defining them in advance according to the automation.
fields.summary: User to have  the ability to select a project or possibility of displaying the create screen when using Manual trigger automation

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In classic projects when the URL loads the segment  "useStoredSettings=true" while Switching between boards the board doesn't load.

This could also happen to some dashboard gadget links but not on all sites.
E.g. In a Days Remaining in Sprint Gadget when clicking on the board links it loads the segment  "useStoredSettings=true".


h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Switch between boards from the board left panel
 # When one has in the URL the segment "useStoredSettings=true" the board doesn't load

Find a video example below:
https://share.getcloudapp.com/llu9xd0q

h3. Expected Results
The boards should load normally

h3. Actual Results
The board doesn't load and the page stays blank

h3. Workaround
Remove from the URL the "useStoredSettings=true" segment
fields.summary: When the URL loads "useStoredSettings=true" while Switching between boards the board doesn't load

fields.description:
Currently under Project Pages, if we connect any space and wish to clear it later, it is not possible.

We can either connect to a different space or disable the Project Page section which is not the best way to disconnect a space.
fields.summary: Possible way to reset Project Pages section

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When the option to move incomplete issues to the next sprint is chosen the issues are not forwarded to the next sprint. The issues go back to the backlog. It definitely makes it difficult for the users to locate each issue and put them in the next sprint again.
h3. Expected Results

The issues should get forwarded to the next sprint.
h3. Actual Results

The request is timing out and the issues go back to the backlog.
 !Screenshot 2021-01-22 at 15.36.08.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Use the following JQL to find the issues that were not moved upon the sprint closure. Then bulk move the issues to the next sprint.
{panel}
sprint in (<old sprint>) and sprint not in (<new sprint>) and status != <close status>
{panel}
fields.summary: Issues are not forwarded to the next sprint upon completing one

fields.description:
h3. *Suggestion:*

To display an error message when an admin without browse permission accesses the Features tab in a next-gen project settings 
h3. *Expected Behaviour:*

When an Admin who does not have browse permission on private a next-gen project accesses the feature tab it should show them a message: 

"*You must have the browse project permission to view this project features.*"
h3. *Current Behaviour:*

When an Admin who does not have browse permission on a private next-gen project accesses the feature tab it keeps loading without any errors.
 *   !Screenshot 2021-01-22 at 3.19.22 PM.png|thumbnail!

h3. *Steps to Replicate:*
 # As an administrator access a Private Next-gen project settings that you are not a Member, Admin, or viewer of.
 # Access the features tab in project settings.
fields.summary: Better error message when an admin without browse permission accesses Features tab in a next-gen project settings

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you clone a *Resolved* ticket, we naturally reset the workflow status to *Open*. The same should happen with the *Epic Status* field. Users get bit by this when their Epics don't appear on their agile boards. Not really sure if *Epic Status* adds any value to begin since it seems duplicative of the issue's status.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Clone an Epic with epic status
 # The new created Epic keeps the epic status

h3. Expected Results
The Epic resolution is cleared

h3. Actual Results
The Epic resolution is done

h3. Workaround
- Separate the workflow for the Epic issue type
- Create a post function to set the Epic resolution as "To Do" in the create transition
fields.summary: Cloning an Epic should reset the Epic Status field

fields.description:
Please add the timespent field as an accessable field for issues that are returned by
Lookup issues in 
Jira Automation
https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/automation-actions/#Automationactions-Lookupissues
fields.summary: Lookup issues & timespend

fields.description: Boards are defined on a filter, which can select multiple projects. It is reasonable to expect that only epics from those projects would presented when looking at the list of epics available (currently it shows all epics from all projects). The suggestion is to have the list of epics grouped to show epics from the project the issue belongs to first, epics from projects which belong to a project within the board you are currently working on second and all other epics in a third group.
fields.summary: Group Epics according to the relevant projects

fields.description:
Request a sprint attribute in the "Complete Sprint" pop-up window, with which the Product Owner can indicate the fulfillment of the sprint goals.
Our teams want to have this attribute (text, check box, or other) to be able to mark the criteria of the sprint goal of each sprint, manually and independently of the resolution of the tasks included in it.
fields.summary: Add an sprint fullfillment atruibute at complete sprint popup

fields.description:
Jira should enable the ability to convert a bug to a story. Often when a defect is found, the effort to fix the issue is more complex and requires more effort. In this case, teams should be able to convert that defect to a story and retain all the artifacts in that defect similarly to how you allow bugs to be converted to sub-tasks. I would argue that the conversion to a story is more appropriate than converting to a sub-task, as that defects' complexity is more than just having a sub-task. I urge you to consider and implement the ability to allow defects to be converted to a story, and perhaps any issue type, if the complexity is not to high to do so.

Thank you
fields.summary: Add Ability to Convert Bug to Story

fields.description:
NextGen boards and Classic boards show different cosmetic views of the issues if 'grouped by subtasks' or 'swimlane by stores', respectively.

Is it possible to have consistency on Nextgen and Classic board view?

 

*Classic Board:* Status appears in the beginning soon after the Issue-key

!image-2021-01-20-15-17-22-725.png|width=344,height=145!

 

*NextGen Board:* Staus appears at the end

!image-2021-01-20-15-18-12-493.png|width=372,height=118!

 

 

 
h3.
fields.summary: Cosmetic view of NextGen boards and Classic boards are different if grouped by subtasks or swimlane by stores respectively

fields.description: It would be a great option if you could switch to a daily Capacity View for teams in Advanced Roadmaps.
fields.summary: Daily Capacity View in Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description:
We have an option to sort the statuses for classic projects by navigating to "Statuses" page and re-ordering the status based on our requirement.

But in terms of next-projects, we do not have an option to sort the statuses based and sorts only based on the *status ID*'s in the backend.

A lot of customers would like to be able to sort these easily with the "order of workflow" being created by default for all the Next-gen projects.
fields.summary: Sort Status by "order of the workflow" instead of "Status ID" for next-gen projects.

fields.description:
I've just created an account to share my deepest frustration with using Jira to track new requirements.

So this just happen and I lost probably an hour of unsaved changes: 
 # I opened a backlog for editing by clicking in the Description's text area
 # I started to write BDD scenarios to ensure my feature is well tested
 ## Bear in mind that as I was creating the scenarios, I did NOT click anywhere else (giving focus outside of the text area)
 # After about an hour, as I'd finished my work, I clicked outside the text area to trigger the automatic save.
 # To my surprise, I got a popup message saying the following: You do not have permission to edit issues in this project.
 # All my work was simply rolled back to the original work item and I lost everything that I've typed for the past hour.

Do you want to know what happened? While I was editing, a colleague flipped the status from open to completed. Just because someone else made a change in the work item status, I SHOULD NOT HAVE LOST ALL MY WORK. A WARNING MESSAGE SHOULD BE THROWN, BUT I STIL SHOULD BE ABLE TO SAVE IT AGAIN OR AT LEAST HAVE TIME TO COPY IT TO MY CLIPBOARD.

 

Seriously, how can I lose all my work because the work was locked out? I understand that it should at least have informed me of what exactly happened, but it shouldn't have RELOADED everything and reverted my changes.

 

This software is so frustrating.
fields.summary: Don't lose unsaved changes if the same backlog item was marked as completed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users from Advanced Roadmaps are not able to create new Releases from the Release tab view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Navigate to a Plan
# Navigate to Release Tab
# For any project, click 'Create release'
# Select 'Fixed date' as option while creating the Release. Receive Something's gone wrong error.


h3. Expected Results
The new Release will be created

h3. Actual Results
 !Screen+Recording+2021-01-19+at+01.33.09+PM.gif|thumbnail! 
The below exception is thrown in logs:
{code}
Error: Date passed to formatDateUTC function is not valid
    at $o (format.js:87)
    at index.js:61
    at t.value (Field.js:221)
    at zi (react-dom.production.min.js:182)
    at Fi (react-dom.production.min.js:181)
    at ba (react-dom.production.min.js:263)
    at lu (react-dom.production.min.js:246)
    at au (react-dom.production.min.js:246)
    at Za (react-dom.production.min.js:239)
    at react-dom.production.min.js:123
{code}

h3. Workaround
Create your Release from the Project instead
fields.summary: Cannot create Releases from a Plan

fields.description:
Description: Since Scrum released their new Scrum 2020 guide; there is now a new artefact called the "Product Goal". The Product Goal does not fit in a sprint because the Product Goal is a long term goal. So if there would be an input field on top of the backlog page, right above the sprints, where you could fill in a Product Goal that would be perfect. It could be a place for all the long term goals. So also for the long term goal you want to reach with your team.

A part from the Scrum guide describing the Product Goal:

"Scrum Artifacts

Scrum’s artifacts represent work or value. They are designed to maximize transparency of key information. Thus, everyone inspecting them has the same basis for adaptation.

Each artifact contains a commitment to ensure it provides information that enhances transparency and focus against which progress can be measured:
 * For the Product Backlog it is the Product Goal.
 * For the Sprint Backlog it is the Sprint Goal.
 * For the Increment it is the Definition of Done.

 These commitments exist to reinforce empiricism and the Scrum values for the Scrum Team and their stakeholders."
fields.summary: Long term goals input field in the backlog view

fields.description:
It would be helpful to look behind the scenes to the most active users so administrators could gather feedback and build an interest group and also to see an activity report on the usage of Advanced Roadmaps, like: shared teams not being used, when was the last time a plan was updated. 
This would help Admins to do some clean ups routines in AR. 
At this time, there is no other way to gather this data.
fields.summary: Usage tracking and statistics for Advanced Roadmaps Plans

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When configuring new issue type hierarchy levels above Epic using Advanced Roadmaps, the Epics are listed under the "Child issues" panel in the issue view of the issue type you've set above Epic.

If you create customized "Parent link" fields and use them in Jira, the child issues are hidden child issues from the "Child issues" view.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a customized Parent link (name: Atlassian-parent-test) 
 # Associated the field with  a project's screen
 # Set both two-parent link fields in an issue of the project related to step #2. 
 # Now you could see all the child issues of parent issue in the view
 # Move the "Atlassian-parent-test" into the trash 

h3. Expected Results

You can see the issues under the "Child issues" panel
h3. Actual Results

In the parent issue, you can't see the child issue anymore
h3. Workaround

" change issue types " :
 # Check the issue that not shown in the "child issues" pannel
 # If it has been upgraded from standard-issue type, ie task , bug,story to other higher-level like epic then try to downgrade first and then upgrade  issue type again 
 # (!) The downgrade/upgrade will cause the original issue links missed. But you could relink that via viewing the issue history
fields.summary: Adding customized "Parent link" fields hides child issues from the "Child issues" view in Epic parents

fields.description: We are committed to protecting the privacy of your and your customers' data, by enabling you to choose where your primary data is located and preventing it from unauthorized access with industry best-practices,Our products are designed for high performance and availability, and built on best-in-class core technologies, such as AWS, so your organization can scale confidently and securely,
fields.summary: Reliability

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When I create a completely new project, a board with 4 columns is created. Whereas a board with just three columns is generated when I create a board via "create a board from an existing project".

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project with using Kanban template or create a Kanban board using "board created with new Software project"
# We see all the 4 default columns on the board Backlog, Selected for Development, Inprogress and Done.
# Create a Kanban board using "create board in an existing project" option, this will show only 3 columns on the board To Do , Inprogress and Done
# By default the Backlog and Selected for Development statuses are mapped under To Do column.

h3. Expected Results
Creating a board in an existing project should show all the 4 columns on the board.

h3. Actual Results
Only 3 columns are visible on the board when created using the "create board in an existing project" option.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Different Columns in Boards with Create new board vs. creating board within a project

fields.description:
I see that there is no automation trigger for clearing done issues in the done column, we can only click it manually. Ideally, for our team, it would be great to have automation for it that runs every week so that we can start the week fresh without having an overload of done issues.

Thankyou!
fields.summary: Automation trigger for "Clear Done Issue" feature

fields.description:
As a Jira user, I want to see if I have edited a field but not saved it so that I can know that it hasn't been saved and I need to do so.
h3. Background

In editing the description of an issue, I clicked on to the field, made my edits, and then clicked off the field in order to make other changes to the ticket. I didn't see an indication that I had pending changes to the description, and so I did not save them before I asked a co-worker to review them. 

Having a flag of some sort on the field showing that saving changes is needed would have prevented this.
fields.summary: Show "Draft exists" flag for fields that have a "Save" button

fields.description:
Software backlogs are great to easily create Jira issues. You can type out an issue summary, press enter, and then type out another. 

However, I would like to be able to assign users to these issues without breaking this workflow. 

If I could write out an issue and '@' mention a user within the issue summary (which automatically assigns it to that user), it would be very productive.

Todoist features similar functionality, and they have extended it to allow automatically setting due dates (e.g. TODAY) and labels.
fields.summary: Assign issue to user inline using '@' symbol

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When moving issues from a next-gen project to a classic project, you are prompted to include child issues if they were not already a part of the initial list of issues to be moved. Selecting this option moves the child issues and where Epic issues are moved sets the Epic Link of the child issues accordingly in the destination project. However, if the Epic issue type was at some point renamed in the source next-gen project, the Epic Link is not populated in the destination project for the moved child issues despite mapping the renamed issue type to the Epic issue type in the destination project.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a source next-gen software project and a destination classic software project
 # Rename the Epic issue type in the source next-gen project to something else, for example 'Project'
# Create a 'Project' issue in the next-gen project and several child issues under it
# Move the 'Project' issue to the destination classic project, selecting the option to move child issues
# In the resulting move operation screens, map the issue types to the corresponding issue types in the classic project, mapping the renamed 'Project' issue type to the default Epic issue type in the classic project
# Execute the move operation

h3. Expected Results
The 'Project' issue is moved to the classic project along with its child issues. The child issues have their Epic Link set to the parent issue accordingly.

h3. Actual Results
The issues are moved but the child issues do not have their Epic Link populated with the moved parent issue.

h3. Workaround
Change the name of the renamed Epic issue type in the source next-gen project back to 'Epic'. This will allow the auto population of the Epic Link to occur for moved child issues.
fields.summary: Move Child Issues Does Not Preserve Epic Link if Next-Gen Epic Issue Type Has Been Renamed

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Advanced Roadmaps allow users to set date custom fields as start and end dates options in the plan, but if the context field isn't set to use "Any issue type", the field cannot be used in Advanced Roadmaps and the message "Make sure to add this field to all the issues sources of this plan" is displayed next to the field.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Access Jira and click *Jira settings > Issues > Custom fields*
# Click on *Create custom field*
# Select the *Date picker* option and click on *Next*
# Type a name to the field, let's say "Start date" and click on *Create*
# Set the field to the desired screens and click on *Update*
# In the custom fields page, locate the field *Start date* and next to it click *more(...) > Contexts and default values*
# Click on *Edit context*
# Under *Choose applicable issue types*, select all the options but leave the option *Any issue type* unselected
# Click *Modify*
# Access an existing plan (or create a new one using the project containing this custom field created)
# Click on *Plan settings (gear icon) > Configure > Scheduling*
# In the *Start date* options menu under * Dates*, try to select the *Start date* option related to your custom field

h3. Expected Results

You can select the custom field you've created

h3. Actual Results

The custom field you've created is greyed-out and the message "Make sure to add this field to all the issues sources of this plan" is displayed next to the field

h3. Workaround

Adjust the context of the field, select the "Any issue type" option. To do this, please follow the steps described below

# Access Jira and click *Jira settings > Issues > Custom fields*
# In the custom fields page, locate the field *Start date* and next to it click *more(...) > Contexts and default values*
# Click on *Edit context*
# Under *Choose applicable issue types*, select the option *Any issue type*
# Click *Modify*

After this, you should be able to select the field in the plan's settings
fields.summary: The field context configuration prevent Advanced Roadmaps to use it as start/end dates fields

fields.description: This would be very useful in a use case where you have a story as a particular issue and the Sub-Tasks on that Story are all individualized work for particular Teams
fields.summary: Assign Teams to Sub-Tasks on Advanced Roadmaps

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Customer performs migration from server to cloud and hit into an error
{code:java}
Caused by: org.postgresql.util.PSQLException: ERROR: null value in column "SCENARIO_ISSUE_CUSTOM_FIELD" violates not-null constraint
 Detail: Failing row contains (15, null, 36681).
 at org.postgresql.core.v3.QueryExecutorImpl.receiveErrorResponse(QueryExecutorImpl.java:2532)
 ***
 message: Error attempting to import Plugin Data backup{code}
h3. Steps to Reproduce

No steps to reproduce here 

 
h3. Expected Results

No exception during the migration process 
h3. Actual Results

Exception as described
h3. Workaround

The root cause is in " AO_D9132D_SCEN_CSTM_FLD_MVAL " table 
{code:java}
Inconsistency in the column names: SCENARIO_ISSUE_CUSTOM_FIELD on cloud vs. SCENARIO_ISSUE_CUSTOM_FIELD_ID on server.

SCENARIO_ISSUE_CUSTOM_FIELD_ID is present where as SCENARIO_ISSUE_CUSTOM_FIELD is not present.
{code}
If there's no data in " AO_D9132D_SCEN_CSTM_FLD_MVAL "  migration is fine. Otherwise, migration will hit the error

QuickFix:

The more proven approach would be to create a data upgrade task + code changes to make cloud use the same column name as serve
fields.summary: Migration error when customer perform migration from server to cloud

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When multiple sprints are started in a next-gen project this causes a conflict that prevents the backlog and board from the project to load.
*This issue was previously addressed in -[JSWCLOUD-18004|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWCLOUD-18004]- but it appears that it is still possible to trigger it*
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Activate multiple sprints in a next-gen project (presumably from a classic board)
 # Attempt to load the next-gen board or backlog

h3. Expected Results
This scenario should not be possible
h3. Actual Results
The sprints are activated and the backlog and board no longer load correctly and throw POST 400 errors with the message below:
{noformat}
Multiple active sprints found for agility board ###
{noformat}

h3. Workaround

The quickest way to resolve this is to delete the extra next-gen sprint(s) that have been started:
 # Navigate to a classic project backlog
 # Assign an issue on the backlog to the next-gen sprint you would like to delete
 # Once the sprint appears on the backlog (refresh if need be), delete this sprint
 # Repeat for all extra next-gen sprints.
fields.summary: Accidentally starting a second sprint from a next-gen project on a classic board causes the backlog and board of the next-gen project to not load

fields.description: The customer wants to be able to share Sprints across Next-Gen projects.
fields.summary: Share Sprints across Next-Gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Some instances experience two problems that amplify each other leading to a bad user experience with slow loading times for Plans nearing the 5000 issue limit. These problems are extra re-rendering and unnecessary re-calculations.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Configure the issue source for the Plan to contain a lot of issues under the 5k limit (eg. 4,323 issues)
 
h3. Expected Results

While some slowness is expected for this amount of issues in the Plan, it should be manageable.

h3. Actual Results

The Plan's initial load time is considerably slow and leads to a poor user experience.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Slow initial load time for Plans on some instances

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Users may see an incorrect Cloud Sprint Report Graphs (i.e. Velocity Chart) where the Committed Sprints may not be counted correct making the Cloud Sprint Report Graphs show them improperly (i.e. Velocity Charts) 
h3. Expected Results

The Cloud Sprint Report Graphs (i.e. Velocity Chart) *{{should show}}* the Committed data correctly matching what is on the Server
h3. Actual Results

The Cloud Sprint Report Graphs (i.e. Velocity Chart) *{{will not show}}* the Committed data correctly matching what is on the Server
h3. Functional Impact

This may not cause any data corruption or inconsistency, this is only related to the Cloud Sprint Report Graphs being reported incorrectly due to some probably internal database discrepancies
h3. Workaround

NONE
fields.summary: The Cloud Sprint Report Graphs (i.e. Velocity Chart) may shows inconsistent Committed Results

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Sprint estimation calculates the Remaining Estimate incorrectly when updating the sub-task estimation.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Once the issues are estimated and moved to the planned sprint, the sprint estimation doesn't include the sub-task estimation
 # From the sprint planning section, navigate to the sub-task in the side panel and update the estimate. Return to the sprint planning section and plan the story of the updated sub-task.

h3. Expected Results
* Remaining estimate of the sprint planning doesn't include remaining estimate's of sub-task

h3. Actual Results

* The Remaining estimate of the sprint planning is updated with the sub-task'ss remaining estimate.

h3. Workaround

 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sprint estimation calculates the Remaining Estimate incorrectly .

fields.description:
When I have large text entered in description, I want make some text bold and italic, then it is unnecessary scroll two times. 

Example: 

I have 100 lines of text.

i want to make some text in line 80, as bold and italic.

Now I have to scroll all the way up and click Bold, the it jumps to line 80. Then in order to make it italic, I have to scroll all the way up and click italic again.

 

Of course we can use short cuts but *why it can not be made as floating tool bar*. As a tester I have add lot of text and repro steps and some times I miss few short cuts and have scroll again and again.
fields.summary: Text editing tools causing trouble to scroll up every time

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
qTest button is showing on issue view from a project that is not integrated with it
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install the app qTest Scenario
 # Configure it to a specific project
 # Create an issue on a project that is not integrated with the app


h3. Expected Results
The button is not displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The button is displayed:
 !qtest_1.jpg|thumbnail! 

(i) The problem only happens on the new issue view.

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: qTest button is showing on a project that is not integrated with

fields.description:
Currently, when using the new issue view, the card layout configuration is defined using the "Issue layout" configuration in the project settings.

In the old issue view, this configuration used to be done by a board so you could have different boards in the same project with different configurations.

The problem is that if you have 2 different boards in the project when using the new issue view, both boards will always have the same issue layout since they get this configuration from the project settings.

There are cases where different teams work on different boards in the same project and they have different needs for fields, so as a Jira Software user, I want to be able to configure the issue layout differently across boards when using the new issue view.
fields.summary: As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to configure the issue layout differently across boards when using the new issue view
Tables in New issue view are fixed and are unreadable in larger tables

fields.description:
It would be useful to restrict the ability to run reports to certain users, by restricting reports to members of specified groups or users individually.

This is useful in cases where Jira instances have external access to customers, so administrators won't want customers to be able to run reports.
fields.summary: Restrict access to reports to some users/groups

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This task should include the following details:
 - Quickstart always shows on top of all elements on the page
 Issue: overlap issue with TodayMarker(Roadmap page).
 - When issue views open, hide Quickstart - it refers to +Open issues in sidebar+, not +Open issues in dialog+
 Issue: for both classic and nex-gen project, Quickstart should be hidden when issue views open, including *Backlog*, *Active Sprint*, and *Kanban board*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Create a new instance in production and QS will be visible and above mentioned issues can be reproduced. For example: When all checklist items in Quick start is completed, it stays in the bottom right corner, when using the quick inline editor from backlog view it goes over the comment box, so you can't see what you are typing. You can still scroll down to see what you are typing, but you have to do it every few words. 
h3. Expected Results

It should not hinder the user when using inline editor or other options in Jira software.
h3. Actual Results
{noformat}
It hinders the user.{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Cancel Quickstart with which user can quickly remove quickstart. Also, this can be re-enabled through Profile option at the nav bar.
fields.summary: Quickstart button issues

fields.description:
Dear support,

 

Currently there is no way for user to identify if specific case is in Backlog or is on Kanban Board. We can use sprint to resolve this, but we are not using scrum based development and hence not using the Sprints.

 

Can this be look into and prioritized?
fields.summary: Ability to know if case is in Backlog or on Next Gen Board

fields.description: As a product owner, I would like to be able to create somehow unfinished/ work in progress tickets. The initial status category of a tickets seems to be "To Do" right from its creation. However, as long as I have not finished my thoughts, the issue is just a draft. It is not yet "To Do" and it should also not be counted into the automatically calculated progress bars on Epics.
fields.summary: Add "Open" Status Category Before "To Do"

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Inconsistency in the sprint capacity between 'Preview' and 'Accept changes' mode during auto-schedule in a plan

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a scrum board issues as shown below.
||Epic Name||Issue||Estimation||Sprint Name||
|Epic 1|Story 1|55|PC Sprint 1|
|Epic 2|Story 2|70||
|Epic 2|Story 3|40||
|Epic 3|Story 4|50||
# Start 'PC Sprint 1' in the board. 
# Create 'PC Sprint 2' in the same board. This will be a future sprint.
# The board will look as shown below.
 !PC Board.png|thumbnail! 
# Create an Advance Roadmaps plan by using above scrum board as the issue source.
# Create a scrum team in the plan with 2 weeks sprint length and 60pts velocity, and associate the scrum board to it.
 !PC Scrum Team.png|thumbnail! 
# Assign all the Epics and Stories to the scrum team created on the plan, and save changes.
# Before the auto-schedule, the plan will look like this in the capacity management view. Note *Story 2*, *Story 4*, and *Story 4* are not assigned to any sprint. No start and due dates assigned to them.
 !Plan Before auto-schedule.png|thumbnail! 
# Auto-schedule the issues with default 'Overwriting issue values' config, and *Preview* the scheduled issues.
 !Preview scheduled issues.png|thumbnail! 
# Since 'Story 1' is assigned to 'PC Sprint 1', it's scheduled during the same sprint which is expected.
# Next one in the plan is 'Story 2' with 70 pts. The auto-scheduled is allocating 60pts to the next future sprint (i.e., 'PC Sprint 2') and remaining 10 pts to next 'Projected sprint'.
 !Preview scheduled issues 1.png|thumbnail! 
# Click on Accept Changes button at the top right-hand corner.

h3. Expected Results
The capacity allocated to future sprint 'PC Sprint 2' during the preview mode should be same after accepting the changes in the plan.

h3. Actual Results
The capacity showing red after accepting the changes as it's allocating all 70pts of 'Story 2' to 'PC Sprint 2' alone even though the start and due dates are spanning across two sprints.
 !Accept changes.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Manually adjust the capacity after auto-scheduling.
fields.summary: Inconsistency in the sprint capacity between 'Preview' and 'Accept changes' mode during auto-schedule in a plan

fields.description: We need the ability to quickly clone issues in Plan view. It would be even better if we could select multiple issues and clone. This is pretty important to quickly creating large amounts of issues at once.
fields.summary: Ability to clone issues in Plan view

fields.description: Hello, the bulk change functionality is great but limiting. Can you please have it apply to all fields including custom fields? Thank you,
fields.summary: Bulk change custom fields

fields.description:
Hello! Our project management teams across our company create large plans with issues for many different reporters. We need to be able to update the reporter field from the plan view before pushing live so the reporters are notified of the issues when created and so we do not have to bulk update it later.

We have had to create a wonky workaround to use a Driver field in the plan view to then push to the Reporter field once published.  It seems pretty basic to have a system field available.

 

Can you please add this?

 

Thank you,
fields.summary: Add Reporter system field to Plan view

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When we edit the Fire Event to a custom event of a post-function, it's triggering notifications despite the user configuration is set to do not receive notifications.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access your Personal Settings (<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/ViewPersonalSettings.jspa)
 # On _Email notifications for issue activity_, select *Don't send me email notifications*
 # Create a custom Generic Event to notify a group (<instance>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/ListEventTypes.jspa)
 # Access any project and go to *Project Settings > Workflows*
 # Edit the workflow by selecting a transition and clicking on *Post Functions*
 # Edit *Fire a Generic Event event that can be processed by the listeners* to that custom event
 # Go back to the board and use the transition which you've edited the post-function

h3. Expected Results
The user should not receive any email notification.

h3. Actual Results
The user is receiving email notifications.

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Post-function Fire event is triggering notification regardless of user configuration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If there are statuses missing the status category and these statuses are added to a project workflow, the creation of a plan using this project as the issue source fails and the preloader spins forever

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have statuses without status category and add them to the workflow of a project, let's call it project A
# Create a plan using project A as the issue source

h3. Expected Results

The plan is created normally

h3. Actual Results

The plan's creation freezes and the preloader keep spinning forever

h3. Workaround

Add the status category to the statuses without category, and to do this please follow the steps described below:

# Go to Jira settings > Issues > Status
# Locate the statuses where describes *No category* under the *Category*
# Click on *Edit*
# Select a value in the *Category* field
# Click on *Update*
fields.summary: Statuses missing the status category prevent the creation of Advanced Roadmaps plans

fields.description:
Whilst you can customise an agile board to include the current issue status in the backlog row, this causes the row to become two lines, and makes it hard to read.

It would be good to be able to show the current status of the issue in the main backlog row, so that I can see quickly which issues near the top of the backlog need progressing before they can be taken into sprint.
fields.summary: Show issue status lozenge in backlog row

fields.description:
In my (non next-gen) project I can adjust when items are cleared off the 'Done' column. It seems to work like a filter and I can flexibly include and exclude items on the Kanban board view.

The roadmap view does not seem to follow the same logic. Here items seems to be gone after 14 days and cannot be brought back. We want to use the roadmap as a tool so we can also look back into the past and see what have we done in a certain time frame (sort of as reporting). This is however not possible and does not seem to be connected to the flexibility described above. I would suggest offering the same flexibility for the roadmap as well.

??Hi everyone,??

??I believe this problem may be caused when the due date field is hidden from the issue screen. Please follow the steps under "Recently completed issues not showing on your roadmap" from [https://support.atlassian.com/jira-software-cloud/docs/troubleshoot-the-roadmap/].??
fields.summary: Include Done Epics in the Roadmap, even after 14 days

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Agile Wallboard Gadget doesn't show the parent issue in the first swimlane



h3. Steps to Reproduce
#  Have a board with Active Sprint in it
# Create some issues with subtask and make sure they are part of Active Sprint
# Configure the Swimlane so that it uses "Stories"
# Create a dashboard and add Agile Wallboard gadget
# Configure the gadget to select the board we created (don't select any Quick Filter) > Save

h3. Expected Results
The parent issue in the first Swimlane is shown.

h3. Actual Results

The gadget is unable to display any issues from the 1st swimlane

 !image-2021-01-05-12-45-06-494.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2021-01-05-12-45-18-949.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Set the Swimlane to None
fields.summary: Agile Wallboard Gadget doesn't show the parent issue in the first swimlane

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Using JQLs to build reports with gadgets is a powerful way to keep tracking information about our projects and issues, as we can have better control over what is going on!
From time to time, we may need to compare the results of the same report in different periods of time, and this might be a bit hard to do, once the reports get only the last updated information.

h3. Suggestion
Create a way to run JQLs to get a snapshot of old information, so we can have a visible and clearer way to check how the issues were in a given past date, for example:
* We run a JQL this week to get information from issues in a determined project (like logged hours, priority, and statuses);
* Next week, we run the same report with the updated status, but the past report did not change its results, so we can compare them both and see what was changed.
fields.summary: Static snapshot of reports

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*

1. Navigate to Kanban Backlog
2. Try to create Epic via Inline
3. Epic is not present in the IssueType list.

Screenshot for reference: (Screenshot 2021-01-05 at 5.46.46 PM.png)

- Following https://www.atlassian.com/agile/tutorials/epics doc, there are three ways to create Epic in a project:

*1*. Create an epic on the Roadmap
*2*. Create an epic from a new issue
*3*. Create an epic from the Epic Panel in the backlog 
 ** To create Epic from the Epic Panel, please enable the "Epic Panel" from the Board Settings. (screenshot: Screenshot 2021-01-05 at 2.04.56 PM.png)


*Requested Feature with Use Case:*
To enable the inline creation of Epic. 
In such scenarios, where the *Epics panel* is disabled, having inline Epic creation functionality in place will be more intuitive for users to be able to create any issue types.
fields.summary: Cannot create Epic via the + Create issue icon at the bottom of the Kanban Backlog

fields.description:
When accessing the column settings of the board, all statuses from the workflow are displayed to be mapped regardless of the filter query.

It would be awesome to limit the statuses according to the filter query.

For example, if the filter query is restricted to one issue type, just the statuses associated with that issue type should be displayed to be mapped.
fields.summary: board settings display all statuses

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Users without administration board permission should not be able to access the "Board settings".

h3. How to replicate
* Add the board administrators as "*site-admins*". 
* Impersonate a user without site admins permission granted.
* Then, the board settings will be available. 
* Result to a user without board admin permission.
 !board settings hide to user without admin permission.png|thumbnail! 
https://share.getcloudapp.com/v1u4BmKn

h3. Improve
* Only board administrators should be able to access the board settings.
* Perhaps we can add an option to disable the read board settings option.
fields.summary: User without administration board permission should not be able to access the "Board settings"

fields.description:
+*User Story:*+ "As a product owner, I need to analyze what the critical path of stories is in my release, so I can more closely track/manage whether we are on schedule or slipping"

+*Background*+: Jira has the ability to use links to define relationships between *stories*.  One of those relationship types is the blocks relationship (Blocks, is blocked by). If these links are properly filled out for *stories*, then a release could be visualized as a Tree structure (or series of trees) where the blocking relationship between *Stories* is shown (blocking relationship between Epics as in Roadmaps are of little value).  The stories that Block other stories but are not blocked themself are root nodes of the release trees.  You would then recursively traverse the stories blocked by the root, and its' children, and its' children's children (etc) to build the tree graph.

+*What is Critical Path*+:
 * In general, the *critical path* is the longest walk in a given story tree (i.e., it has the most amounts of stories that block each other)
 * A slang term for this is "the long pole in the tent" of the release

+*Why is Critical Path Important?:*+
 * Assuming each story is properly sized to fit in a sprint, and best case scenario where you don't start a sprint where one ticket blocks another, you immediately have a rough estimate on the number of sprints needed
 ** If there are 8 stories in the critical path, ideal # of sprints is 8 to complete the release
 * The critical path is the highest risk to meeting any schedule for a release, so it allows you to properly identify, track, and manage the development risk of a release
 ** If any story on the critical path doesn't get completed in a sprint, your release likely has released a schedule slip of a sprint if you don't find a way to get the critical path back on schedule

+*How to determine the Critical Path:*+

There should be two ways to determine the critical path in a story tree in a Release:
 * *Unweighted* - all stories are weighted the same, so the critical path is simply the longest walk (distance) from the root to a leaf in the tree
 * *Weighted by Story Points* - use the Story points estimates to weigh the edges in the tree
 ** Using an example below, the path that has the highest weight in this example really is the riskier development path; however, the PO should be aware of both of these situations, and be able to use Jira tools to quickly identify these
 *** 10 stories that all blocks each other but are just 1 story point each
 **** 10 point weighted distance
 **** 10 point unweighted distance
 *** 5 story that all block each other but are 5 story points each
 **** 25 point weighted distance
 **** 5 point unweighted distance

+*How to display the Critical Path:*+

As mentioned, it is possible to have multiple story trees in a release, so that would need to be handled

*Visually:*
 * Each story tree should be able to be shown individually, or as a whole in the release
 * Story trees should be a proper tree structure, where the Story Ticket # is the label on each tree node
 * For a given child node, the child's level should be determined as:(Max of all it's blocking parents) plus one
 * As you toggle between the weighted and unweighted visualization options, the critical path(s) should be shown highlighted (I recommend red relationship edges)

*Textually*:

Although a little harder to ascertain the information, the critical path for a tree can also be viewed as simply a table list of the stories in the walk.  So, the root story would be the first one, then its child on the critical path is the second story in the table, and so on.

+*Jira feature notes:*+

The current concept in Roadmaps where dependancies are analyzed at an Epic level really are not of value for a development team that has more than 3 developers.  An Epic is just a theme of stories that can be organized by the PO in a way that makes sense for the development team to find the stories they are working on.  In a given release you may only have a few Epics, but 100 stories - tracking the dependancies of stories is where the value is

The Dependancies report also does not provide the information in a manner that digests what somebody needs to get out of it.
fields.summary: Add in Critical Path Analysis(via story links) in JIRA (possibly as part of Roadmaps)

fields.description:
Currently, Advanced Roadmaps plans show a progress bar next to Epics and other higher levels in the issue hierarchy but it shows the progress of that particular level only.

As an Advanced Roadmaps user, I want to be able to see the overall progress of a project/plan in a similar way. I'd like to see the completion percentage of all issues in a single project/plan, as well as the number of on-going and completed issues.
fields.summary: As an Advanced Roadmaps user, I want to be able to see the overall progress of a plan/project

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

User is unable to transition to all possible transitions on a sprint board, because the UI limits the range in which a card can be moved (limited to within size of swimlane).

An example of this is if there is a sprint board that has swimlanes enabled, there is only 1 card in that swimlane, and there are 4 or more statuses/transitions that appear in the next column. Since there is only 1 card in the swimlane, the height of the swimlane is reduced to that of the one card, and the card is unable to move beyond that swimlane border.

Screen recording:

[Rank_disabled_UI_bug_2.mov^!https://getsupport.atlassian.com/images/icons/link_attachment_7.gif|width=7,height=7!^|https://getsupport.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/5425638/5425638_Rank_disabled_UI_bug_2.mov]
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a board with swimlanes enabled, and have one issue under that swimlane.
 # Create about 4 or more transitions from one status to another (ex. from In progress to Done), so that multiple transitions/statuses appear stacked on a column when moving a card to that column.
 # Notice that you can move the card all around the screen and select any of the transitions/statuses in the column.
 # Then, *disable rank* on your board and try the same - the card will be confined to the limits of the swimlane, and not allow you to select all of the transitions/statuses

h3. Expected Results

We should be able to select the right transition.
h3. Actual Results

We cannot select among the transition.
h3. Workaround

We can open the ticket and transition through the transition option inside of the ticket.
fields.summary: User unable to move issue to multiple statuses if there is only one issue in the swimlane

fields.description:
Currently, the JQL search does not allow users to order their results by Rank as the rank field suggested is the one used for Classic projects. 
The Rank field for each Next-gen project is actually not displayed to be used.

It would be nice to have such option.
fields.summary: Ability to order JQL results for Next-gen issues by rank

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating an epic in a next-gen project is setting automatically the _Start Date_ field to *2020/12/04*

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access a next-gen software scrum project
 # Go to the roadmap
 # Create an epic

h3. Expected Results
The Epic should be created with empty fields (default)

h3. Actual Results
The Start Date field is automatically set to *2020/12/04*

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Creating an epic set automatically Start Date

fields.description:
h3. Problem

On Roadmaps, issues are being shown with strike-through even though they're not since no Resolution is set:

https://share.getcloudapp.com/rRu0z7jp
h3. Suggested Solution

It would be a good approach to follow board's behavior (since Roadmaps is applied on each project and located right below the board).
h3. Why This Is Important

This behavior is different from what happens on board and on Advanced Roadmaps, what might be confusing.

On the board, the strike-through is only applied if the issue has its Resolution set.

On Advanced Roadmaps, the strike-through is not applied no matter if the Resolution is set.
h3. Workaround

There is no workaround at this moment.
fields.summary: Unresolved issues appear as resolved (strike-through) on Roadmaps if their status is in Done category

fields.description:
h4. +Summary+
When Swimlanes are based on Epics and there are Issues linked to Epics which are not available in the board, then these Issues are still visible in Backlog (for Scrum) & Kanban Backlog (Kanban) but invisible in Active Sprints (both Scrum and Kanban)

h4. +Steps to reproduce+
# Create board A (Scrum) for project A, which should filter all issues in project A
# Create project B, then create Epic B in project B
# Create Issue A in project A, then link it to Epic B
# Create a sprint in board A, add Issue A to it and start it
# Configure board A and base Swimlanes on Epics

h4. +Expected behavior+
Issue A is visible in Active Sprints of board A

h4. +Actual behavior+
Issue A is invisible in Active Sprints of board A

(i) In Backlog mode, all the 4 issues are visible

The workaround suggested elsewhere is to change the Saved Filter to:
project = "This Project" OR ( project = Epics AND type = epic ) ORDER BY Rank ASC
fields.summary: Stories from external epics disappear in swimlanes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When using the Branch created trigger in Jira automation, The option "User who triggered the event" does not work to set the branch creator as the assignee of the issue related to the branch.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Integrate both Jira and Bitbucket applications
 # Create the following automation rule in one of your integrated projects:
!Screen Shot 2020-12-28 at 14.43.13.png|width=381,height=118!
 # Navigate to any issue of the project and click to create a branch:
!Screen Shot 2020-12-28 at 14.48.54.png|width=466,height=155!

h3. Expected Results

The issue is assigned with the user who created the branch
h3. Actual Results

The issue is not assigned.
h3. Workaround

None so far.
fields.summary: The option "User who triggered the event" does not work for Branch created trigger in Jira automation

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
The *Initiatives* are shown as issues of *Standard Issue* Type. The customer would like to have a separate view for Initiatives on the Board. 

h3. Suggested Solution
Add Initiatives View in the Boards
fields.summary: Add Initiatives View in the Boards

fields.description:
h3. Problem

When there are no issues unassigned, the "Unassigned" in the user picker is still shown in the Board and Backlog view:

!image-2020-12-28-10-56-01-023.png|width=267,height=102!

!image-2020-12-28-10-56-14-435.png|width=267,height=102!
h3. Why this is important

It might drive the user to think that, even though clicking on "Unassigned" doesn't return any issues, there might be issues that meet these criteria and the user doesn't have access to.
fields.summary: Hide the "Unassigned" option from the user picker if no matching issues

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Advanced Roadmap fields, such as *Target Start*, do not trigger Automation events like Field Updated or Issue Updated.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create one Epic and one Story and an Advanced Roadmap plan;
 # Create an Automation Rule that will watch Issue Updated or Field Updated triggers and select the Target Start field. See example:
 !Image 2020-12-23 at 5.14.10 PM.jpg|thumbnail!
 # Go to the plan and update the Target Start field.

_Using a different field in the same automation, such as Due Date, will properly execute the rule._
h3. Expected Results

The Automation Rule won't be triggered.
h3. Actual Results

The Automation Rule should be triggered when the Target Start field is updated on the plan.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Advanced Roadmap fields do not trigger automation events
